TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ECDsa extends System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Provides an abstract base class that encapsulates the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class serves as the abstract base class for <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> derivations.

MemberSignature.Value: protected ECDsa ();
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa"> class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is called by classes that derive from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> class. The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng> class is the only implementation currently supported by the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. You may provide your own custom implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).
Docs.returns: A new instance of the default implementation (<see cref="T:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng">) of this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create (System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve curve);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve curve) cil managed

Docs.param: The curve to use for key generation.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) with a newly generated key over the specified curve.
Docs.returns: A new instance of the default implementation (<see cref="T:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng">) of this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create (System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters parameters);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters parameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The parameters representing the key to use.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) using the specified parameters as the key.
Docs.returns: A new instance of the default implementation (<see cref="T:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng">) of this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create (string algorithm);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create(string algorithm) cil managed

Docs.param:
The name of an ECDSA implementation. The following strings all refer to the same implementation, which is the only implementation currently supported in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](../../add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]:
\- "ECDsa"
\- "ECDsaCng"
\- "System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng"
You can also provide the name of a custom ECDSA implementation.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).
Docs.returns: A new instance of the specified implementation of this class. If the specified algorithm name does not map to an ECDSA implementation, this method returns `null`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you develop your own implementation of an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa> object, you can use the Create method overload to create a custom string that specifies your implementation.
If you specify a custom value for the parameter, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptoConfig> object will use it to determine whether an ECDSA object can be created.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters ExportExplicitParameters (bool includePrivateParameters);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters ExportExplicitParameters(bool includePrivateParameters) cil managed

Docs.param: `true` to include private parameters; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, exports the explicit parameters for an elliptic curve.
Docs.returns: The parameters representing the point on the curve for this key, using the explicit curve format.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters ExportParameters (bool includePrivateParameters);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters ExportParameters(bool includePrivateParameters) cil managed

Docs.param: `true` to include private parameters; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, exports the named or explicit parameters for an elliptic curve. If the curve has a name, the <see cref="F:System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters.Curve"> field contains named curve parameters, otherwise it contains explicit parameters.
Docs.returns: The parameters representing the point on the curve for this key.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void GenerateKey (System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve curve);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GenerateKey(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECCurve curve) cil managed

Docs.param: The curve to use.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, generates a new public/private key pair for the specified curve.

Docs.param: The binary stream to hash.
The algorithm to use to hash the data.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, computes the hash value of the specified binary stream by using the specified hashing algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual byte[] HashData (byte[] data, int offset, int count, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);

The index of the first byte in to be hashed.
The number of bytes to hash.
The algorithm to use to hash the data.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, computes the hash value of the specified portion of a byte array by using the specified hashing algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ImportParameters (System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters parameters);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ImportParameters(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.ECParameters parameters) cil managed

Docs.param: The curve parameters.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, imports the specified parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string KeyExchangeAlgorithm { get; }
.property instance string KeyExchangeAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the key exchange algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is inherited from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm> base class.
The Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) is used for digital signature generation; it is not used for key derivation Therefore, this property returns `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string SignatureAlgorithm { get; }
.property instance string SignatureAlgorithm

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the signature algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual byte[] SignData (byte[] data, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] SignData(unsigned int8[] data, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: The input data for which to compute the hash.
The hash algorithm to use to create the hash value.
Docs.summary: Computes the hash value of the specified byte array using the specified hash algorithm and signs the resulting hash value.
Docs.returns: The ECDSA signature for the specified data.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual byte[] SignData (System.IO.Stream data, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] SignData(class System.IO.Stream data, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

The hash algorithm to use to create the hash value.
Docs.summary: Computes the hash value of the specified stream using the specified hash algorithm and signs the resulting hash value.
Docs.returns: The ECDSA signature for the specified data.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual byte[] SignData (byte[] data, int offset, int count, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] SignData(unsigned int8[] data, int32 offset, int32 count, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: The input data for which to compute the hash.
The offset into the array at which to begin using data.
The number of bytes in the array to use as data.
The hash algorithm to use to create the hash value.
Docs.summary: Computes the hash value of a portion of the specified byte array using the specified hash algorithm and signs the resulting hash value.
Docs.returns: The ECDSA signature for the specified data.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract byte[] SignHash (byte[] hash);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] SignHash(unsigned int8[] hash) cil managed

Docs.param: The hash value of the data that is being signed.
Docs.summary: Generates a digital signature for the specified hash value.
Docs.returns: A digital signature that consists of the given hash value encrypted with the private key.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool VerifyData (byte[] data, byte[] signature, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);
.method public hidebysig instance bool VerifyData(unsigned int8[] data, unsigned int8[] signature, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: The signed data.
The signature data to be verified.
The hash algorithm used to create the hash value of the data.
Docs.summary: Verifies that a digital signature is valid by calculating the hash value of the specified data using the specified hash algorithm and comparing it to the provided signature.
Docs.returns: `true` if the signature is valid; otherwise, `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool VerifyData (System.IO.Stream data, byte[] signature, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);
.method public hidebysig instance bool VerifyData(class System.IO.Stream data, unsigned int8[] signature, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: The signed data.
The signature data to be verified.
The hash algorithm used to create the hash value of the data.
Docs.summary: Verifies that a digital signature is valid by calculating the hash value of the specified stream using the specified hash algorithm and comparing it to the provided signature.
Docs.returns: `true` if the signature is valid; otherwise, `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool VerifyData (byte[] data, int offset, int count, byte[] signature, System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool VerifyData(unsigned int8[] data, int32 offset, int32 count, unsigned int8[] signature, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm) cil managed

Docs.param: The signed data.
The starting index at which to compute the hash.
The number of bytes to hash.
The signature data to be verified.
The hash algorithm used to create the hash value of the data.
Docs.summary: Verifies that a digital signature is valid by calculating the hash value of the data in a portion of a byte array using the specified hash algorithm and comparing it to the provided signature.
Docs.returns: `true` if the signature is valid; otherwise, `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract bool VerifyHash (byte[] hash, byte[] signature);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool VerifyHash(unsigned int8[] hash, unsigned int8[] signature) cil managed

Docs.param: The hash value of a block of data.
The digital signature to be verified.
Docs.summary: Verifies a digital signature against the specified hash value.
Docs.returns: `true` if the hash value equals the decrypted signature; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The signature is first decrypted by using the public key, and then compared to the hash value for verification.
